Title: Revenue Accounting Manager, New Products and Initiatives
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization
At Lyft, our mission is to improve peoples lives with the worlds best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.
The Lyft Accounting team is seeking a proactive and results-driven Revenue Accounting Manager. In this critical and highly visible role, you will serve as a technical revenue accounting expert and strategic advisor to key stakeholders, overseeing complex revenue transactions while providing thoughtful leadership across the organization. This role will work closely with cross-functional teams to ensure new product and initiative launches drive accurate financial reporting in a high-growth, fast-paced environment. As part of a dynamic and collaborative accounting organization, you will play a pivotal role in enhancing the Revenue accounting function, establishing new processes and procedures, creating robust documentation, and playing a pivotal role in scaling the revenue accounting function. You will help drive process improvements, establish best practices, and support the companys continued growth and transformation. This role will begin as an individual contributor.
Responsibilities: 

Join a dynamic and highly collaborative accounting organization and play a critical role in overseeing revenue accounting considerations for new products and initiatives.
Partner with Engineering and Product Management teams to design and implement scalable revenue recognition processes for new product launches, ensuring compliance with accounting standards (e.g., ASC 606).
Identify opportunities to enhance opportunities to automate existing revenue processes and enhance system capabilities.
Prepare internal summary documentation for new products and initiatives, (less rigorous than a memo) summarizing key stakeholders, findings, and accounting impacts.
Own the revenue accounting review of contracts with customers, partner with technical accounting team to ensure proper documentation under ASC 606 and that any nonstandard findings are properly documented and accounted for.
Assist with revenue technology transformation initiatives and process enhancements to improve efficiency and accuracy.
Regularly partner with cross-functional teams, such as Financial Systems, FP&A, Financial reporting, Technical Accounting, Data team, and Accounts Receivables to ensure timely and accurate reporting.
Provide workpapers, ad-hoc analysis, and inputs to the FPA process. Address revenue-related inquiries from other departments and assist external auditors during audits.
Ensure compliance with revenue accounting policies, procedures and SOX controls. Assess and enhance SOX compliance processes related to revenue accounting.
Train internal stakeholders on revenue recognition principles, best practices, and policy updates.
Lead or participate in special projects and process improvements related to revenue recognition.

Experience: 

BS in Accounting/Finance, CPA license preferred
5+ years in Accounting including revenue recognition, including Big 4 experience
Strong knowledge of revenue recognition principles and accounting standards (ASC 606)
Deep expertise in US GAAP, SEC reporting requirements, SOX, and internal controls
Experience working with engineering, data, and other technical teams preferred
Experience working with large data sets with SQL and Mode Reporting preferred
Strong organizational, verbal, and written communication skills
Strong accounting research and problem-solving skills with a focus on revenue recognition
Highly detail-oriented and able to multitask
Strong quantitative and qualitative analytical skills with the ability to review and analyze revenue contracts and transactions for accuracy
Must have significant experience in Microsoft and Google applications; Oracle is strongly preferred
Able to operate independently and as part of a larger functional team
Ability to build cross-functional relationships, deadline driven, and take initiative to drive results

Title: Policy Operations Lead
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. We aim to achieve this by cultivating a work environment where all team members belong and have the opportunity to thrive.
We are seeking an experienced Policy Operations Lead to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for implementing, operationalizing, and managing pre-written platform policies, ensuring they are effectively executed across the organization in alignment with our mission, values, and regulatory requirements. This position focuses on translating policy into action through robust operational processes, requiring exceptional execution skills and cross-functional collaboration.
Responsibilities:

Drive the implementation of policies across relevant teams and functions
Translate policy requirements into actionable operational procedures, workflows, and guidelines
Collaborate with Safety Policy, Legal, Product, Public Policy, Regulatory Operations, and other cross-functional teams to ensure effective policy execution
Continuously evaluate implementation effectiveness through data analysis and stakeholder feedback (e.g. thorough retros, improvements to change management procedures, documentation, communication, etc.)

Operational Excellence

Translate complex policies into actionable operational procedures and guidelines
Build scalable processes for policy implementation across multiple teams and regions
Define and track key performance indicators to measure policy effectiveness and operational efficiency
Identify opportunities for process improvement and lead implementation of solutions


Stakeholder Management and Communication

Build and maintain relationships with internal stakeholders including Legal, Product, Engineering, and Customer Support
Develop clear communication strategies to ensure policy changes are effectively communicated to relevant teams
Collaborate with external partners, including industry associations and regulatory bodies when needed
Present policy updates and performance metrics to senior leadership


Team Leadership

Manage a team of policy operations specialists, providing mentorship, guidance, and professional development
Set clear objectives and success criteria for the policy operations function
Foster a collaborative culture that encourages innovation, continuous improvement, and excellence
Implement effective change management practices to drive cross-functional alignment and adoption


Risk Assessment and Mitigation

Conduct thorough analysis to identify emerging trends, risks, and areas requiring policy attention
Develop proactive strategies to mitigate potential risks to users and the platform
Stay informed about industry developments and regulatory changes, advising on potential impacts
Lead incident response from a policy perspective, ensuring consistent application and documenting learnings



Experience:

Required

5+ years of experience in policy operations, program management, strategy & operations, or similar strategic implementation-focused roles
Demonstrated success in operationalizing and implementing policies that balance user experience, business needs, and risk management
Strong experience working with cross-functional teams to drive alignment and execution
Track record of using data and metrics to track implementation success and operational efficiency
Excellent project management skills with ability to manage multiple initiatives simultaneously


Preferred

Experience in a fast-growing technology company or marketplace platform
Background in policy operations related to online safety, content moderation, or user protection
Experience working with legal and compliance teams in regulated environments, and/or trust and safety operations experience
People management experience, with proven ability to build and develop high-performing operations teams


Skills and Attributes

Exceptional operational and execution-focused mindset
Outstanding process design and implementation abilities
Strong written and verbal communication skills for clear operational guidelines
Excellent influencing skills and ability to drive cooperation among diverse stakeholders

Title: Data Scientist, Decisions - Driver Experience & Segments
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our mission is to improve peoples lives with the worlds best transportation. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.
The Driver team aims to provide a best in class driving and earnings experience that enables anyone to join the platform and make a living. As a Data Scientist on the Driver Experience & Segments team, you will collaborate with our world class team of engineers, product managers, and designers to design the end-to-end driving experience for hundreds of thousands of drivers who interact deeply with our app every day.  You will be a key partner in creating innovative ways to reward and recognize our best drivers, building tools to provide guidance to drivers on how to maximize their earnings, and designing the best UI and personalized XP to match the right rides to the right drivers quickly. This Scientists role will inform the driver experience for all drivers, in particular our most valuable ones, and help to improve their take home earnings.
Data Science is at the heart of Lyfts products and decision-making. You will leverage data and rigorous, analytical thinking to shape our Driver products and make business decisions that put drivers first. This will involve identifying and scoping opportunities, shaping priorities, recommending technical solutions, designing experiments, and measuring the impact of new features.
Responsibilities:

Leverage data to provide insights around driver behavior and sentiment and identify improvement opportunities
Apply analytics, inference and experimentation techniques to solve business problems
Design and analyze experiments; communicate results to technical and non-technical audiences to act on launch decisions
Establish metrics that measure the health of our driver products and driver experience
Develop analytical frameworks and dashboards to monitor business and product performance
Partner with product managers, engineers, and operators to translate analytical insights into decisions and action, and implement products to drive business goals
Design and implement data pipelines to support data analysis and product implementation

Experience:

Degree in a quantitative field such as statistics, economics, applied math, operations research or engineering (advanced degrees preferred), or relevant work experience
4+ years experience in a data science role or analytics role
Proficiency in SQL - able to write structured and efficient queries on large data sets
Experience in programming, especially with data science and visualization libraries in Python or R
Experience in online experimentation and statistical analysis, and communicating results and recommendations to senior stakeholders
Strong oral and written communication skills, and ability to collaborate with and influence cross-functional partners 
Experience in applying machine learning techniques a plus (e.g. reinforcement learning) to solve customer problems (e.g. personalization, segmentation)
Experience working with ETL pipelines a plus

Title: Software Engineer
RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. We aim to achieve this by cultivating a work environment where all team members belong and have the opportunity to thrive.
Lyft connects people to transportation to change the way we live and get around our communities. Lyfts engineering team is growing rapidly, and we are looking for Software Engineers with a passion in Security to help us scale. Come be part of the Security team at Lyft focused on enabling and empowering engineering teams to deliver secure services at scale.
Our drivers and passengers entrust Lyft with their personal information and travel details to get where they're going and expect us to keep that data safe. Lyft's security team leads efforts across the company to ensure our systems are secure and worthy of our users' trust.
The security team designs and builds Lyft's security architecture, consults with other teams as they build and launch new products and features, proactively plans for the unexpected, and responds to incidents that occur. Our work affects the entire company and takes place at all levels of the stack, from infrastructure to web application security, as well as mobile apps, IT, and autonomous vehicles. We try to approach security from a software engineering standpoint. We believe in scaling security through automation and tooling and we ship frequently. Check out our blog posts at https://eng.lyft.com/tagged/security to learn more about some of the things weve built.
We're looking for an engineer who's excited about growing and improving security at Lyft by building systems and promoting security throughout the company. You'll play a part in shaping the future of security at Lyft, and your work will have significant impact and visibility.
Responsibilities:

Architect and build services that improve the security of our systems with an eye towards scalability and avoiding unnecessary friction.
Evangelize our shared security responsibility model by collaborating with other Infrastructure teams at Lyft to ensure that our services and workflows are secure by default.
Work on embedding security best practices such as least privilege, isolation, monitoring, authentication and authorization across our infrastructure
Develop critical services that Lyft depends on such as our credential management service that provides secrets to all our services at Lyft.
Provide rich data to engineers at Lyft to drive manual and automated decision making by working on our open-source service Cartography, which shows relationships between our infrastructure assets.
Ensuring least privilege is enforced by improving role-based access control and Identity Access Management for our users and services

Experience:

Solid experience with a high level programming language (bonus points for experience with Python, Go-lang and shell scripts)
Experience with (or a deep interest in) computer security
When facing a problem that's poorly defined or outside of your expertise, you can quickly learn what you need to dig in, make sense of the problem, and start working towards a solution
You're a great communicator, and can advocate for your proposals while also empathizing with your teammates' goals and priorities
You understand that security work must be prioritized because all teams have finite resources. You have good judgment and a sense of when to compromise and when to hold your ground
Understanding of computer network security or major computer networking protocols (e.g. TCP/IP, HTTP, TLS, DNS).
Nice to haves:

Experience with Amazon Web Services (AWS) or any other major cloud service provider
Kubernetes and container security and running fleets of endpoints or servers in the cloud.  
Cryptography, PKI, or key distribution
Running multi-tier or distributed web applications at scale

RoleDescription:
At Lyft, our purpose is to serve and connect. To do this, we start with our own community by creating an open, inclusive, and diverse organization.
Lyfts Mapping team builds and operates a mapping platform that powers Rideshare-specific experiences  everything from offering Riders accurate pricing and ETAs to navigating Drivers safely and efficiently from pickup to dropoff. This role is focused on the critical interface between Mapping and Marketplace, where billions of API calls daily to Mapping services power every aspect of our realtime marketplace that dynamically matches riders and drivers 24/7. In this role you will dive into driver pay and rider pricing, understanding the nuances of how routing, ETAs, and regional tolls impact these financial levers and partner with Driver and Rider teams to reimagine how our users engage with these Mapping-powered inputs. And most importantly you are customer obsessed and excited about understanding how our product works from the inside out but also from the outside in by dogfooding the product as a Lyft Rider and a Lyft Driver. In this role on the Mapping team, you will tackle all of these challenges and more, with end to end ownership over a wide range of Mapping/Marketplace experiences from data quality to backend services to frontend app UX. This role has the potential to positively impact millions of Riders and Drivers every day by ensuring a seamless and safe ride experience for every ride.

Completely own your teams products  existing or new  from ideation, through development, launch, growth, and maintenance
